Short Stories - High.title: The Sandcastle
Short Stories - High.story: Mia and her friend Sofia love going to the beach every weekend. They always bring buckets, shovels, and sunscreen. Last Saturday, they decided to build the biggest sandcastle ever. They worked for two hours, digging and piling sand. When they were almost done, a big wave came and washed part of it away! Instead of getting upset, Mia and Sofia laughed and started rebuilding. They learned that sometimes things don't go as planned, but you can still have fun.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Things don't always go as planned but you can still have fun
Stay positive when things go wrong
Having a good attitude when things don't work out

images.label: Boy helping grandmother in the garden

Short Stories - High.title: Grandma's Garden
Short Stories - High.story: Every Sunday, Marcus visits his grandmother to help her in the garden. She grows tomatoes, cucumbers, and bell peppers. Marcus likes pulling weeds and watering the plants. His grandmother always tells him stories while they work. Last week, she told him about how she started gardening when she was his age. Marcus feels proud when he sees the vegetables grow. He knows his help makes a difference.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Helping others makes you feel proud
Spending time with family is important

images.label: Frustrated girl working on a puzzle

Short Stories - High.title: The Puzzle Challenge
Short Stories - High.story: Emma had been working on a 500-piece puzzle for three days. She was getting frustrated because she couldn't find the right pieces for the sky. Her dad noticed she was upset and sat down next to her. He suggested they sort the pieces by color first. Once they organized everything, the puzzle became much easier. Emma finished it that night and felt so accomplished. She learned that having a strategy can make hard tasks easier.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Having a strategy makes hard tasks easier

Short Stories - High.title: Tide Pool Explorer
Short Stories - High.story: Carlos was exploring tide pools at the beach with his mom. He saw tiny crabs, sea stars, and colorful anemones. His mom explained that tide pools are like small oceans trapped in rocks when the water goes out. Carlos was careful not to touch the animals because his mom said it could hurt them. He took pictures instead. Carlos decided he wanted to learn more about ocean life when he got home.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Being careful with animals in nature

Short Stories - High.title: Setting the Table
Short Stories - High.story: Ava and her brother Noah have a chore chart at home. This week, it was their turn to set the table for dinner. Ava put out the plates and napkins while Noah placed the cups and silverware. At first, Noah put the forks on the wrong side, but Ava kindly showed him where they go. Their parents were happy to see them working together. Teamwork made the job faster and more fun.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Teamwork makes work easier and more fun
Working together helps get things done

images.label: Girl teaching brother to tie shoes

Short Stories - High.title: Tying Shoes
Short Stories - High.story: Lily noticed her little brother Ben was struggling to tie his shoes. He kept getting frustrated and wanted to give up. Lily remembered how hard it was when she first learned. She sat down with him and taught him the "bunny ears" method. They practiced together for twenty minutes. By the end, Ben could tie his shoes all by himself! He was so excited, and Lily felt proud that she could help.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Helping others learn makes you feel proud
Patience and practice help people learn

Short Stories - High.title: Beach Picnic Adventure
Short Stories - High.story: The Martinez family planned a beach picnic for Saturday. They packed PB&J sandwiches, fruit, and lemonade. When they arrived, they found the perfect spot under a palm tree. After eating, they played in the waves and collected shells. Just as they were about to leave, dark clouds appeared. They quickly packed up and made it to the car before the rain started. It was an adventure they would always remember.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Unexpected events can make experiences memorable
Enjoying time together as a family

images.label: Boy looking for a lost dog

Short Stories - High.title: Finding Biscuit
Short Stories - High.story: Tyler's dog, Biscuit, got out of the backyard through a hole in the fence. Tyler was very worried and started looking everywhere. He asked his neighbors if they had seen Biscuit. One neighbor said she saw a dog that matched Biscuit's description near the park. Tyler ran to the park and found Biscuit playing with another dog! Tyler was so relieved. He and his dad fixed the fence that same day.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Don't give up when searching for something important
Asking for help can solve problems

Short Stories - High.title: Self-Checkout Helper
Short Stories - High.story: Zoe went grocery shopping with her mom. Her mom let her use the self-checkout machine. Zoe carefully scanned each item and placed it in the bag. She almost forgot to scan the bananas, but her mom reminded her. Zoe also helped count the change. She felt grown-up being able to help with shopping. Her mom said she was becoming very responsible.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Taking responsibility makes you feel grown-up

Short Stories - High.title: A Good Friend
Short Stories - High.story: During free time, James noticed his friend Andre sitting alone looking sad. James walked over and asked if everything was okay. Andre said he was upset because his family was moving to a new city. James listened carefully and told Andre that they could still be friends and video chat. He also said he'd help Andre make the most of the time they had left. Andre felt better knowing James cared.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Being a good friend means listening and caring

Short Stories - High.title: Soccer Practice
Short Stories - High.story: Maya wanted to make the community soccer team, but she wasn't very good at dribbling. She decided to practice every day after finishing her homework. Her older sister helped by being the goalkeeper. After two weeks of practice, Maya tried out for the team. She made it! The coach even said her dribbling had improved a lot. Maya learned that hard work and practice really do pay off.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.

Short Stories - High.title: The Disagreement
Short Stories - High.story: Jasmine and her best friend Keyla had an argument about what game to play. Jasmine wanted to play video games, but Keyla wanted to do an art project. They both got upset and didn't talk for an hour. Later, Jasmine thought about it and realized they could do both. She apologized to Keyla and suggested they do art first, then play video games. Keyla agreed, and they had a great time doing both activities.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?

Short Stories - High.title: Surf Lessons
Short Stories - High.story: Daniel always watched surfers at the beach and dreamed of learning. For his birthday, his parents signed him up for surf lessons. The first day was harder than he expected. He kept falling off the board and swallowing salt water. But his instructor encouraged him to keep trying. By the third lesson, Daniel could stand up and ride small waves. He couldn't wait to show his friends.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?

images.label: Girl reading a story to her sibling

Short Stories - High.title: Bedtime Stories
Short Stories - High.story: Every night before bed, Olivia reads a story to her little brother Max. Max loves hearing about adventures and animals. Olivia uses different voices for each character, which makes Max laugh. Reading together has become their favorite part of the day. Olivia has noticed that Max is starting to recognize some words on his own. She feels happy knowing she's helping him learn.

Short Stories - High.title: Beach Cleanup
Short Stories - High.story: The Chen family joined a beach cleanup event on Saturday morning. They wore gloves and carried trash bags. Ethan was surprised by how much litter they foundâ€”water bottles, wrappers, and even an old flip flop. His mom explained that trash can hurt ocean animals. Short Stories - High.title: The Presentation
Short Stories - High.story: Isabella had to give a presentation about dolphins for her homeschool co-op. She was nervous because she didn't like speaking in front of people. Her dad suggested she practice in front of the mirror and then present to the family first. Isabella practiced five times. When the day came, she was still nervous, but she remembered everything she wanted to say. Everyone clapped when she finished, and Isabella felt relieved and proud.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?

Short Stories - High.title: Saving Up
Short Stories - High.story: Ryan wanted to buy a new video game, but it cost forty dollars. His parents said he had to save his own money. Ryan did extra chores around the house to earn money. He washed the car, helped fold laundry, and organized the garage. After six weeks, he finally had enough. Buying the game felt extra special because he had earned it himself.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Earning something yourself makes it more special

Short Stories - High.title: The New Neighbor
Short Stories - High.story: A new family moved in next door to Sophia. She noticed a girl her age who looked shy and lonely. Sophia decided to introduce herself and invite the girl, named Priya, to play. Priya was happy to have a new friend. Sophia showed her around the neighborhood and told her about the nearby beach. By the end of the day, they had exchanged phone numbers and made plans to hang out again.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.

images.label: Boy caring for a pet bunny

Short Stories - High.title: Pet Bunny Care
Short Stories - High.story: Leo has a pet bunny named Clover. Every morning, Leo feeds Clover fresh vegetables like bell peppers and lettuce. He also makes sure Clover has clean water and a tidy cage. On weekends, Leo lets Clover hop around the backyard while he watches. Taking care of Clover has taught Leo responsibility. He knows that pets depend on their owners to keep them healthy and happy.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?

images.label: Kids working on a science project

Short Stories - High.title: Science Project Partners
Short Stories - High.story: Aiden and his partner Grace were assigned a science project about ocean ecosystems. At first, they had trouble agreeing on ideas. Aiden wanted to focus on coral reefs, while Grace preferred deep sea creatures. They decided to combine both ideas and create a project that showed different ocean zones. Working together, they built a diorama and wrote a report. Their project turned out better than either could have done alone.

Short Stories - High.title: Learning from Mistakes
Short Stories - High.story: Hannah was rushing to finish her math homework so she could watch TV. She didn't check her work and turned it in the next day. When she got it back, she had made many careless mistakes. Hannah felt disappointed in herself. She decided that from then on, she would always double-check her work, even if it took extra time. Her next assignment had no mistakes at all.

images.label: Boy swimming in the deep end

Short Stories - High.title: Overcoming Fear
Short Stories - High.story: Jordan was afraid of swimming in deep water. He always stayed in the shallow end of the pool. His swim instructor noticed and worked with him slowly. First, Jordan practiced floating. Then he learned to tread water. After many lessons, Jordan finally swam in the deep end for the first time. He was nervous but also excited. Overcoming his fear made him feel brave.

images.label: Family preparing for a beach trip

Short Stories - High.story: The night before their beach trip, the Wilson family worked together to get ready. Mom made PB&J sandwiches while Dad loaded the cooler. Short Stories - High.title: Growing Sunflowers
Short Stories - High.story: Mia planted sunflower seeds in her backyard and checked on them every single day. After a week, nothing had grown, and she felt frustrated. Short Stories - High.title: Sharing the Tablet

Short Stories - High.title: Trying Paddleboarding

Short Stories Level 2.title: Susanna's Tablet
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Susanna bought a new tablet online last week and it was delivered to her house today. She was excited to open the box and start using it. She bought the tablet for learning, searching online, and for all the great apps.

Short Stories Level 2.title: Building a Sandcastle
Short Stories Level 2.story:
The Rivera family goes to the beach every Sunday. Last week, they decided to build a giant sandcastle together. Dad dug the moat while Mom helped shape the towers. The kids decorated it with shells they found nearby.

It took them almost two hours to finish. When they were done, they took pictures to remember their creation. Even though the waves washed it away later, they didn't mind. The fun was in building it together.

Short Stories Level 2.title: Marcus Helps in the Kitchen
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Marcus wanted to help make dinner. His mom said he could help wash the vegetables. He carefully washed the bell peppers and cucumbers in the sink. Then he dried them with a clean towel.

His mom was happy to have a helper. She let Marcus put the vegetables in the salad bowl. Marcus felt proud that he contributed to the family meal. He wants to help in the kitchen more often now.

What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Marcus helped make dinner and felt proud of contributing
Marcus enjoyed helping his mom in the kitchen

Short Stories Level 2.title: Ava's Bird Watching
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Ava loves watching birds at the beach. Her grandmother gave her binoculars for her birthday. Now she can see the birds up close without disturbing them. She has seen pelicans, seagulls, and even a heron.

Ava keeps a notebook where she draws the birds she sees. She writes down the date and what the bird looked like. Her collection is growing every week. She hopes to see a dolphin next time.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Ava enjoys bird watching at the beach and keeps track of the birds she sees
Ava uses binoculars to watch and draw birds

Short Stories Level 2.title: Jayden's Homework Routine
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Every afternoon, Jayden does his homework right after his snack. He likes to get it done early so he can play later. He sets up his desk with all his supplies before he starts. This helps him stay focused.

Today, Jayden had math and reading homework. The math was easy, but reading took longer. He finished everything in one hour. Now he has the rest of the evening free to play outside.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Jayden has a good homework routine that lets him play after finishing
Jayden does his homework early so he can have free time later

Short Stories Level 2.title: Sophie Walks the Dog
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Sophie's neighbor, Mrs. Chen, broke her ankle last month. She asked Sophie if she could help walk her dog, Buster. Sophie was happy to help. She walks Buster every afternoon after she finishes her work.

Buster is a friendly golden retriever who loves walks. Sophie enjoys spending time with him. Mrs. Chen is grateful for the help. She always thanks Sophie and tells her what a kind neighbor she is.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Sophie helps her injured neighbor by walking her dog every day
Sophie is a kind neighbor who helps Mrs. Chen with her dog

Short Stories Level 2.title: Playing in the Waves
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Liam and his sister Mia love playing in the waves. They wait for the waves to come and then jump over them. Sometimes the waves are too big and knock them down. They just laugh and get back up.

Their dad watches them from the shore to make sure they stay safe. He taught them to never go too far into the water. Liam and Mia always follow the rules. Playing in the waves is their favorite part of beach days.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Liam and Mia have fun playing in the waves while staying safe
The kids enjoy playing in the waves and follow safety rules

Short Stories Level 2.title: Tyler Organizes His Room
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Tyler's mom asked him to organize his room. It was getting hard to find things because everything was messy. Tyler decided to start with his closet. He put all his shirts together and all his pants together.

Next, he organized his bookshelf by putting similar books next to each other. Finally, he cleaned out his desk drawers. The whole project took two hours. Now Tyler can find everything easily, and his room looks great.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Tyler organized his messy room and now can find things easily
Tyler cleaned and organized his room

Short Stories Level 2.title: Family Picnic at the Park
Short Stories Level 2.story:
The Johnson family packed a picnic lunch and headed to the park. They brought PB&J sandwiches, fruit, and lemonade. They found a nice spot under a big tree where it was shady and cool.

After eating, they played catch and took a walk around the pond. They saw ducks swimming and turtles sunbathing on rocks. It was a relaxing afternoon. The family decided to make picnics a regular thing.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: The Johnson family had a relaxing picnic at the park
The family enjoyed their picnic so much they want to do it regularly

images.label: Girl learning to use a camera

Short Stories Level 2.title: Isabella Learns Photography
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Isabella got a camera for her birthday. She wants to learn how to take good pictures. Her uncle, who is a photographer, offered to teach her. They practiced taking pictures of flowers in the backyard.

Her uncle showed her how to hold the camera steady and how to focus. Isabella's first pictures were blurry, but she got better with practice. By the end of the day, she took some really nice photos. She can't wait to practice more.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Isabella learned photography from her uncle and improved with practice
Isabella got better at taking pictures by practicing

Short Stories Level 2.title: Daniel at the Farmer's Market
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Every Saturday, Daniel goes to the farmer's market with his dad. They buy fresh fruits and vegetables from local farmers. Daniel likes picking out the oranges and apples. He always chooses the ones that look the best.

This week, they also bought fresh bread and flowers for the table. Daniel enjoys talking to the farmers and learning where the food comes from. The farmer's market has become one of his favorite weekend activities.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Daniel enjoys going to the farmer's market with his dad every Saturday
Daniel likes buying fresh food and learning from farmers

Short Stories Level 2.title: Emma's Get-Well Card
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Emma's friend Zoe was sick and had to stay home for a week. Emma wanted to do something nice for her. She decided to make a get-well card with colored pencils and stickers.

On the card, she drew pictures of them playing together at the beach. She wrote a kind message telling Zoe she hoped she felt better soon. Emma's mom helped her drop off the card. Zoe loved it and said it made her feel happier.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Emma made a get-well card to cheer up her sick friend Zoe
Emma did something kind to make her sick friend feel better

Short Stories Level 2.title: Washing the Car Together
Short Stories Level 2.story:
The family car was really dirty from a trip to the beach. Dad suggested they wash it together. Everyone had a job. Mom sprayed the car with water, Dad scrubbed the sides, and the kids washed the wheels.

They got a little wet and soapy, but it was fun. Working together made the job go quickly. In less than thirty minutes, the car was sparkling clean. Dad said teamwork makes everything easier.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: The family worked together to wash the car and had fun doing it
Teamwork made washing the car quick and enjoyable

images.label: Boy reading on a rainy day

Short Stories Level 2.title: Owen's Rainy Day Reading
Short Stories Level 2.story:
It was raining outside, so Owen couldn't go to the beach like he planned. At first, he was disappointed. But then he found a book about ocean animals that looked interesting. He curled up on the couch and started reading.

The book had amazing pictures of sharks, whales, and jellyfish. Owen learned so many new facts. Before he knew it, two hours had passed. Sometimes rainy days can turn into good reading days.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Owen turned a disappointing rainy day into a good reading day
Owen found something fun to do when his beach plans were cancelled

Short Stories Level 2.title: Mia Practices Piano
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Mia has been taking piano lessons for six months. At first, playing was really hard. Her fingers didn't move the way she wanted them to. But her teacher told her that practice makes progress.

Now Mia practices for twenty minutes every day. She can play three songs all the way through. Her family loves listening to her play after dinner. Mia is proud of how much she has improved.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Mia improved at piano by practicing every day
Practice helped Mia get better at playing piano

Short Stories Level 2.title: Planting Flowers with Grandma
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Grandma invited Lily and her brother to help plant flowers in her garden. She had bought pink and yellow flowers at the store. Grandma showed them how to dig small holes and place the flowers inside.

The kids carefully covered the roots with soil. Then they watered each plant. Grandma said the flowers would grow big and beautiful with sunshine and water. Lily can't wait to visit again and see how tall they've grown.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Lily and her brother helped Grandma plant flowers in her garden
The kids learned how to plant flowers with their grandmother

Short Stories Level 2.title: Carlos Plans the Beach Trip
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Before going to a new beach, Carlos and his dad looked at a map online. They wanted to find the best spot for swimming. The map showed where the lifeguard stations were located.

It also showed where the restrooms and parking areas were. Carlos helped his dad plan the route to get there. When they arrived, they knew exactly where to go. Planning ahead made the trip much easier.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Carlos and his dad planned their beach trip ahead of time using a map
Planning ahead made the beach trip easier

Short Stories Level 2.title: Grace Sorts Recycling
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Grace's family started recycling last month. Grace is in charge of sorting the recyclables. She puts paper in one bin, plastic in another, and cans in a third. She rinses out containers before putting them in the bins.

Grace learned that recycling helps protect the environment. It keeps trash out of the ocean and saves resources. She feels good knowing she is doing something helpful. Even small actions can make a big difference.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Grace helps the environment by sorting recycling for her family
Grace feels good about recycling because it helps protect the environment

Short Stories Level 2.title: Aiden Sets the Table
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Every night, Aiden's job is to set the table for dinner. He puts out plates, cups, napkins, and silverware for everyone. He makes sure the forks go on the left and the spoons and knives go on the right.

At first, he needed help remembering where everything goes. Now he can do it all by himself. His parents appreciate his help. Having a job at home makes Aiden feel like an important part of the family.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Aiden feels important by helping set the table every night
Having a job at home makes Aiden feel like part of the family

Short Stories Level 2.title: Stargazing at the Beach
Short Stories Level 2.story:
One night, the Martinez family stayed at the beach after sunset. They spread out a blanket on the sand and looked up at the stars. Dad pointed out different constellations like the Big Dipper.

Mom brought a telescope so they could see the moon up close. The kids were amazed by how many craters they could see. It was a special evening they would always remember. They want to go stargazing again soon.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: The Martinez family had a special stargazing night at the beach
The family enjoyed looking at stars and the moon together

Short Stories Level 2.title: Bella Makes a Smoothie
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Bella wanted to make a fruit smoothie. Her mom said she could help. Together, they gathered bananas, strawberries, and orange juice. Bella peeled the bananas while Mom washed the strawberries.

Mom used the blender because it has a sharp blade. Bella watched and then poured the smoothie into glasses. It was delicious! Bella liked making something healthy with her mom. They plan to try new smoothie recipes next time.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Bella and her mom made a delicious fruit smoothie together
Bella enjoyed making a healthy smoothie with her mom

Short Stories Level 2.title: Lucas Helps His Sister
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Lucas noticed his little sister Ava was having trouble with her puzzle. The pieces were all mixed up and she looked frustrated. Lucas sat down next to her and offered to help.

He showed her how to find the edge pieces first. Then they sorted the pieces by color. Working together, they finished the puzzle in no time. Ava gave Lucas a big hug. She was glad to have a helpful big brother.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Lucas helped his frustrated sister finish her puzzle
Lucas was a helpful big brother who helped Ava with her puzzle

Short Stories Level 2.title: Maya Returns the Wallet
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Maya found a wallet on the ground at the store. It had money and cards inside. She didn't know who it belonged to. Her mom said they should take it to the customer service desk.

The worker at the desk thanked Maya for being so honest. Later, the wallet's owner came to pick it up. He was so relieved and thanked Maya. Doing the right thing made Maya feel proud.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Maya did the right thing by returning a lost wallet
Being honest made Maya feel proud when she returned the wallet

Short Stories Level 2.title: Sunscreen at the Beach
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Before playing at the beach, the whole family put on sunscreen. Dad helped the kids put it on their backs where they couldn't reach. Mom reminded everyone to put some on their ears and noses too.

They have to reapply sunscreen every two hours, especially after swimming. Sunscreen protects their skin from getting burned. Nobody wants to be red and sore later! Taking a few minutes to put on sunscreen is worth it.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: The family puts on sunscreen to protect their skin at the beach
Sunscreen is important to prevent getting sunburned

Short Stories Level 2.title: Nathan's Pet Fish
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Nathan has a pet fish named Bubbles. Every morning, he feeds Bubbles a small pinch of fish food. He also checks to make sure the water is clean. Once a week, his dad helps him clean the tank.

Nathan likes watching Bubbles swim around. He talks to his fish every day, even though Bubbles can't talk back. Taking care of a pet has taught Nathan responsibility. He makes sure Bubbles has everything he needs.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Nathan learned responsibility by taking care of his pet fish
Nathan takes good care of his fish Bubbles every day

Short Stories Level 2.title: Zoe's Journal
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Zoe started writing in a journal every night before bed. She writes about what happened during the day. She also writes about her feelings and things she's grateful for. Sometimes she draws pictures too.

Zoe's mom said journaling is a good way to express yourself. It helps Zoe think about her day and remember the good parts. She has been journaling for two months now and has almost filled her whole notebook.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Zoe uses journaling to express herself and reflect on her day
Journaling helps Zoe think about her day and her feelings

Short Stories Level 2.title: The Lemonade Stand
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Olivia and her friend Jake wanted to earn some money. They decided to set up a lemonade stand in Olivia's front yard. They made a big pitcher of lemonade and colorful signs.

Many neighbors stopped by to buy lemonade. By the end of the afternoon, they had earned twelve dollars. They split the money evenly. Olivia and Jake were proud that their hard work paid off.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Olivia and Jake earned money by working hard at their lemonade stand
The kids' hard work at the lemonade stand paid off

Short Stories Level 2.title: Ethan's Doctor Checkup
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Ethan went to the doctor for his yearly checkup. The nurse measured his height and weight. Then the doctor checked his ears, eyes, and throat. She listened to his heart with a stethoscope.

The doctor said Ethan was healthy and growing well. She reminded him to eat fruits and vegetables and to get plenty of sleep. Ethan was glad the checkup was easy. He got a sticker before he left.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Ethan had an easy doctor checkup and learned he was healthy
Ethan's yearly checkup went well and he got a sticker

Short Stories Level 2.title: Sophia Packs for Vacation
Short Stories Level 2.story:
Sophia's family was going on a beach vacation. She had to pack her own suitcase. Mom gave her a list of things to bring: clothes, pajamas, flip flops, and toiletries. Sophia checked off each item as she packed it.

She also brought her favorite book and a stuffed animal. Mom checked her suitcase to make sure she didn't forget anything. Sophia felt grown-up packing by herself. She's excited for the trip!

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: Sophia felt grown-up packing her own suitcase for vacation
Sophia packed her suitcase by herself for the beach trip

Short Stories Level 2.title: Cleaning Up After Beach Day
Short Stories Level 2.story:
After a fun day at the beach, the Garcia family packed up their things. They shook the sand off their towels and folded them neatly. They made sure to pick up all their trash and throw it away.

Dad said it's important to leave the beach clean for other people and for the animals that live there. The kids helped carry everything back to the car. Even though they were tired, they felt good about cleaning up.

questions.question: Retell the story in your own words.
What was the main idea of the text?
answer: The Garcia family cleaned up after their beach day to keep the beach nice
It's important to leave the beach clean for others and for animals
